node.title: Locked down Territorians battling 40 degree heat, as some fined $5,000 for escaping community
node.alt: Lisa Mumbin,Â the chair of Jawoyn Association, speaks on the issues faced during the COVID-19 lockdown.
node.description: Aboriginal communities in the Northern Territory are being challenged by a unique set of circumstances as residents are forced to stay in their homes for what could be weeks on end.
node.content:
["Lisa Mumbin knows how important it is for people to isolate at home during the Northern Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak.", "However, the Jawoyn elder is acutely aware of how challenging that can be.", "\"Aboriginal people in community, we've always lived our lives together, and share things,\" she said.", "Ms Mumbin lives in the Kalano community on the north side of Katherine, which has been in lockdown since the emergence of a COVID-19 cluster more than a week ago.", "\"My home is always welcome to my family,\" she said.", "\"[But] being home now, sometimes there's family coming in, which I try very hard to stop them.", "", "
\"As Aboriginal people we don\u2019t live very long \u2026 with COVID, it\u2019s even worse,\" Lisa\u00a0Mumbin says.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "The restrictions in Katherine and Kalano are tough, but residents are still allowed to leave their homes for exercise, food, caregiving or essential work.", "It's a different story 15 kilometres to the south-west, where the communities of Binjari and Rockhole are facing some of the harshest lockdown rules seen in Australia.", "Except for an emergency or for medical care, about 350 residents have been ordered not to leave their homes until\u00a0at least December 4.", "The hard lockdown directive was issued on Saturday, after nine people in Binjari tested positive to COVID-19.", "There are fears more cases will emerge in both communities.", "\"They are in a hard lockdown, to protect them,\" Acting Chief Health Officer\u00a0Dr Charles Pain\u00a0said.", "The temperature has been reaching 40 degrees.", "Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker yesterday said six people from Binjari had been fined more than $5,000 each after sneaking out during the night.", "\"If you need food, if you need anything, please make contact with the police officers and the other government staff that are on the ground \u2014 we will try and facilitate whatever you need,\" he said.", "\"Please do not leave, you must stay within the Binjari community for the time being, until we give you further notice.\"", "Peggy Slater, who lives in Binjari, said she was frustrated that some people were failing to abide by the rules.", "\"They just seem to [not] listen,\" Ms Slater\u00a0said.", "\"And they've been taking off to town through the bush tracks.\"", "", "
The community of Binjari is 16 kilomtres south-west of Katherine.(ABC News: Kate Ashton)
", "She said she was coping with the restrictions reasonably well herself.", "But, she said, the lockdown was especially difficult for other families, some of whom are sharing two-bedroom homes with up to 20 people.", "\"I just think about all the other people on the community, especially with the influx of kids and people that have come from other places that got stuck here,\" Ms Slater said.", "She was also concerned for her unvaccinated mother, who has cancer and lives in a nearby house.", "Ms Slater\u00a0said her sister-in-law, who resides in another property in Binjari, ran out of power earlier in the day and was left without air conditioning.", "\"Everybody's probably having a bit of tension in the houses, you know.\"", "The charity Save the Children said it was trying to ease the pressure by helping coordinate the delivery of support packages to affected families, including food and electricity tokens.", "\"They will, of course, have all the other essential stuff that you need when you can't get to the shops, like shampoo, conditioner, stuff for washing your clothes and all the things that women need at certain times,\" its NT director, Noelene Swanson, told ABC Radio Darwin.", "She said they were hoping to get some activity packs delivered to children in Binjari and Rockhole over the next few days.", "With the crisis set to drag on for days, if not weeks, Ms Mumbin encouraged Aboriginal residents to get vaccinated.", "\"There is no better way to protect ourselves if we want to live longer,\" the former chair of the Wurli Wurlinjang Health Service said.", "\"You know, as Aboriginal people, we don't live very long,\"", "\"With COVID, it's even worse.\"", "", "
